text:
This question is based on Literary Appreciation.
Football is the only sport on earth that can be considered truly global. Simple and inexpensive. it is equally likely to be found in a tight Marseille banlieue, an obscure corner of a Lagos slum, and the heart of a Buenos barrio. Marley's music is similarly universal...
According to the excerpt above, football is
explanation:
The writer says that Football is the only sport that is truly global as it can be found anywhere in the world. The writer compares football to Marley's music. He says "Marley's music is similarly universal..."
The use of the conjunction "but" in option C, makes the sentiment different from that of the writer. The writer makes use of the word "inexpensive" instead of cheap to avoid the negative connotation attached to the word "cheap".
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Literary Appreciation.
"The commission has the power to investigate, 
to conciliate to hold hearings, to order
reinstatement of a discharged employee, and
to direct the appointment of a qualified applicant"
 
The rhetorical device used in the excerpt above is
explanation:
Parallelism is the repetition of similar grammatical constructions through a line of literary work for rhetorical effect. The repetition of the construction "to ..." as in "to investigate,/ to conciliate, to hold hearings, to order..." helps to achieve that rhetorical effect and to make the poem more memorable to the audience.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Literary Appreciation.
"Lonely road,
Not a star
Lonely road
Shadows far
And quiet"
Peter Abraham Lonely Road.
 
The rhyme scheme in the excerpt above is
explanation:
The rhyme scheme in the excerpt is ababc.
Lonelyroad a
Not a star b
Lonelyroad a
Shadows far b
Andquiet c
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Alex Agyei-Agyiri's Unexpected Joy at Dawn.
The setting of the novel is
explanation:
The novel is set in  Ghana and Nigeria, with the immediate space in Accra, Ghana while more of the events in the latter take place in Lagos, Illere and Ijase. The setting alternates between the countries.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Alex Agyei-Agyiri's Unexpected Joy at Dawn.
Wachuk in the novel is
explanation:
Wachuk is Idem's husband. He works at a printing press in Mafoluku.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In Senghor's Black Woman, the dominant literary device is
explanation:
In "Black Woman" by Leopold Sedar Senghor, the dominant literary device is metaphor. Senghor frequently compares the black woman to abstract and natural elements, such as the earth, the sun and a divine presence, to celebrate her beauty, strength and cultural significance. These metaphor are central to the poem's themes of identity and appreciation of African heritage.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Sesay's "The Song of the Woman of My Land" is a
explanation:
A panegyric poem is a poem that formally praises someone or something publicly. Oumar Farouk Sesay's "The Song of the Women of My Land" is written to recognise the efforts of the women in colonial Sierra Leone. He praises them for their resilience despite the harsh and oppressive conditions that they faced.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In Eliot's "Journey of the Magi", "six hands at an open door" is an example of
explanation:
In T.S. Eliot's "Journey of the Magi," the phrase "six hands at an open door" uses synecdoche, a figure of speech in which a part represents a whole or a whole represents a part. Here, "six hands" refers to three people (in this case, the Magi on the journey).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Osundare's "The Leader and the Led" is
explanation:
Niyi Osundare's "The Leader and the Led" is a satiric poem as it is written to mock the leaders and followers in post-colonial Africa, particularly Nigeria. He compares the leaders to various animals to provide vivid descriptions of the failures of our African leaders who put their selfish interests above all else.
Osundare mocks the leaders and followers in post-colonial Africa with the aim of correcting them.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The poet persona in Donne's "The Good Morrow" reflects on
explanation:
One of the major ideas expressed in John Donne's "The Good Morrow" is that true love will never die. Other types of love may prove to be temporary, but true love will stand the test of time. We find this idea in the third stanza of the poem, where the poet's persona states: 'My face in thine eyes,/ thine in mine appears/ And true plain hearts do in the faces rest." Their love for each other shows in their eyes.
Furthermore, the poet's persona refers to himself and his lover as "two hemispheres" and claims that "whatever dies was not mixed equally;/ if two lovers be one, or, thou and I/ Love so alike, that none do slacken, none can die." Here, he states that both of them are not only halves of one entity but a complete union of two souls. Their love will never die because their love is not a mere union of bodies; it is a union of souls. All of these portray the immortality of their love.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The style of Chibuike's "A Government Driver on His Retirement" is
explanation:
One Chibuike's "A Government Driver on His Retirement" is a narrative poem. It narrates the tragic story of a government driver on the day of his retirement. He chooses to celebrate with alcohol after years of being sober and carefully to his duties. However, he drinks too much and he heads home in his car. This intoxication is what leads to his tragic death. The poem teaches the devastating impact of intoxication and poor decisions and how it can undo all the good that we have done.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
"But a caged bird stands on the grave of dreams"
The excerpt above from Angelou's "Caged Bird" implies that caged bird

options.D: walks freely to actualise its dream

explanation:
In Maya Angelou's "Caged Bird". the line "But a caged bird stands on the grave of dreams" symbolises the frustration and despair of being trapped, with no freedom to pursue one's aspirations. The "grave of dreams" suggests that the bird's hopes and desires are buried, unattainable due to its confinement. This imagery conveys a sense of deep frustration rather than literal death or freedom.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Lawrence's "Bats" is a
explanation:
D.H Lawrence's "Bats" is a dramatic monologue in which the speaker shares personal observations and emotions about bats. It blends vivid imagery with subjective reflection to capture the speaker's changing perspective on the creatures. It begins with admiration, then confusion, then discomfort and finally disgust.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Wole Soyinka's The Lion and the Jewel
Lakunle declines to pay bride price on Sidi because he sees tradition as
explanation:
Lakunle declines to pay bride price on Sidi because he sees the tradition as barbaric. Lakunle labels the culture that persists on a bride price being paid before a man can marry a woman as "a savage custom, barbaric, outdated" (p. 7)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The question is based on Wole Soyinka's The Lion and the Jewel
The play is a
explanation:
Wole Soyinka'sThe Lion and the Jewelis a comedy that uses humour and witty dialogue to explore themes such as tradition versus modernity, gender roles and cultural identity.While the play addresses social issues, its tone remains light-hearted and the resolution involves no tragic consequences. This makes it a comedic work.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on John Osborne's Look Back in Anger
Alison and Jimmy are accommodated during the first month of their marriage by
explanation:
Hugh Tanner is Jimmy's friend who took Alison and Jimmy into his apartment in the first months of their marriage. He was Jimmy's partner when they went on "raids" against Allison's upper-class friends at fancy parties, and Jimmy saw him as a co-conspirator in the class struggle.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on John Osbourne's Look Back in Anger
The protagonist in the play is
explanation:
The protagonist of John Osbourne'sLook Back in Angeris Jimmy Porter. The drama revolves around his unhappy marriage with Alison and his hatred of the upper-class, older generation of English men.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on John Osbourne's Look Back in Anger
The couple's marital crisis is aggravated by
explanation:
In John Osbourne'sLook Back in Anger, Helena Charles, Alison's friend, plays a significant role in aggravating the couple's marital crisis. She not only influences Allison to leave Jimmy but also becomes romantically involved with him after Alison's departure.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on John Osborne's Look Back in Anger.
The reason why Jimmy easily gets along with Cliff is because

options.A: they both belong to the working class
options.C: the relatives of Jimmy's mother are rich
options.D: they are both from affluent backgrounds

explanation:
In Osborne'sLook Back in Anger, Jimmy and Cliff share a close bond because they both come from working-class backgrounds. This shared experience fosters mutual understanding and camaraderie, in contrast to the tension between Jimmy and Alison, who comes from an upper-class family.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on John Osborne's Look Back in Anger.
Jimmy's harmatia is
explanation:
In John Osborne'sLook Back in Anger,Jimmy's hamartia (tragic flaw) is his uncontrolled anger and bitterness toward society, class structures, and those around him. His constant outbursts and inability to express his emotions constructively create rifts in his relationships, especially with Alison.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Buchi Emecheta's Second Class Citizen
Adah is so obsessed with the sleek woman at the hospital because the woman
explanation:
In Buchi Emecheta'sSecond Class Citizen,Adah admires and becomes obsessed with the sleek woman at the hospital because the woman has a caring and loving husband. This contrasts sharply with Adah's own troubled married to Francis. The sleek woman is "showered with presents of flowers, funny dolls that made mad music, beautiful boxes... that contained all sorts of things" (pg. 124) and it never occurs to Adah that "such things could be real" (p. 125).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Buchi Emecheta's Second Class Citizen.
Adah's disappointment is in the overwhelming
explanation:
Adah's disappointment stems from the racial discrimination she experiences and observes in England. Despite her high hopes for equality and better opportunities.she is confronted with the harsh realities of being treated as inferior due to her race and status as an immigrant.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Buchi Emecheta's Second Class Citizen
The main challenge Adah encounters in England is
explanation:
"you may be living like an elite but the day you land in England, you are a second-class citizen" (pg. 43). This is what Francis reminds his wife of when she lands in England and questions the terrible apartment that Francis had secured for them.
In their desire to find a new abode, husband and wife have to contend with discrimination because of the colour of their skin. "Her house-hunting was made more difficult because she was black." In some places where there is a vacant room, "nearly all notices had 'Sorry, no coloureds' on them" (p. 76). Gradually, she learns that "her colour was something she was supposed to be ashamed of" (p. 76).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
The question is based on Emily Bronte's Wuthering Heights
The structure of the novel is based on two major conflicts of
explanation:
In Emily Bronte'sWuthering Heights,the structure of the novel revolves around two major conflicts driven by passion. The intense, consuming love between Heathcliff and Catherine is the central force that shapes the narrative. Their passion leads to destructive consequences for themselves and those around them.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Emily Bronte's Wuthering Heights
The setting of the novel is
explanation:
Emily Bronte'sWuthering Heightsis set in mid-18th century England. The novel takes place over several generations with the main events unfolding in the years following the late 1700s.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Emily Bronte's Wuthering Heights
The novel can be described as a
explanation:
Emily Bronte'sWuthering Heightsis a Victorian novel. It was published during the Victorian era (1847). Like most Victorian novels, it:
1. Explores the issue of class and the social hierarchy. Characters like Heathcliff struggle against the constraints of their social class.
2. It explores the human psyche. The novel's characters are emotionally intense, with Heathcliff and Catherine's obsessive love and inner turmoil being central to the narrative.
3. It contains Gothic elements, such as the supernatural and the darker aspects of human nature
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on Emily Bronte's Wuthering Heights.
Heathcliff considered himself the second half of
explanation:
Heathcliff considers himself the second half of Catherine Earnshaw. In Wuthering Heights, Heathcliff and Catherine share a deep, obsessive connection and Heathcliff believes that they are two halves of a whole.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.
The collection of images within a literary work is referred to as
explanation:
Imagery is the use of vivid and descriptive language that appeals to the senses and creates pictures in the minds of the readers. It is a collection of images that enhance the meaning or emotional effect of the work.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on general literary principles
The leading character in a literary work is the
explanation:
The protagonist is the leading character in a literary work. He is the one who faces the central conflict and whose actions drive the plot forward.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A long narrative poem that relates heroic exploits is
explanation:
An epic is a long narrative poem that recounts the heroic exploits of a central figure or group, often involving grand events or adventures.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.
A poem of eight rhyming lines is
explanation:
A poem of eight rhyming lines is an octave.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
This question is based on General Literary Principles.
The events that make up the story is the
explanation:
The plot is the sequence of events that make up a story, including the conflict, rising action, climax, falling action and resolution. It is the structure that organises the events and actions in the narrative.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.
